Desc.entry: Part of Sheffield Libraries, Archives and Information Services, and the key to a unique collection of national and international standards and specifications as well as trade literature and technical journals for both ferrous and non-ferrous metals. The databank includes over 200,000 individual current and historical metal grades, identifying chemical, mechanical and physical properties; comparable materials; heat treatment; corrosion, fatigue and fracture properties and is available by subscription. 20,000 metal datasheets are currently available online at http://www.mi21.com as part of the MI-21 (Metals Information for the 21st Century) database. The remaining 180,000 datasheets, as well as the additional resources and services of WMI, are available by telephone, fax or email. Can offer training on metals information as well as speakers to promote the service to business and industry.
